title: Real Time Economics: Trade Tensions Escalate (Again) | China’s Economy Advances | Employers Turn to Teens
text: This is the web version of the WSJ’s daily economic newsletter. You can sign up for daily delivery here. In today’s issue, U.S.-China trade tensions rise, China’s economy outperforms expectations, America’s housing shortage extends beyond the coasts, Trump taps two for the Fed, employers turn to teens, U.S. consumers take a first-quarter breather, and the U.K. unemployment rate falls   Real Time Economics: Fed No Longer Worries About Deflation | Currency Market Jitters | Idaho's Growing Pains Next It's Tax Day 2018, And Republicans Aren't Complaining About High Taxes
